p: The thrombolytic activity of a drug is defined as the ability to dissolve dangerous clots in blood vessels, improve blood flow, and prevent damage to tissues and organs. Thrombolytic agents are used to treat a heart attack, stroke, deep vein thrombosis, pulmonary embolism, and occlusion of peripheral artery or indwelling catheter [ 93]. These agents work by converting plasminogen to plasmin, which breaks down the fibrinogen to fibrin and thus dissolve the clot. It was reported that the methanolic extract of Leea indica leaves showed moderate thrombolytic effect [ 94] suggests that other plants belong to Leea genus might have such activity and need to do further study to explore their activity.
